page.title: 06EDUCATION:WENHAM AND RAYDON
page.content: There is no school in Great Wenham so children of primary school age attend Capel St.Mary primary school.Secondary school age children attend East Bergholt High School until the age of 16 when they transfer to sixth form colleges in Ipswich if they wish to continue their education.Some children attend independant or fee paying schools in Ipswich. In Raydon the village school closed in the summer of 1984 after 100 years.It was opened in 1884 as a National school.The falling school roll had caused the county education department to take this step and now primary school children are conveyed by bus out of the village to Stratford St.Mary where a new primary school was opened in the autumn of 1984.The last headteacher of Raydon primary was peripatic,Mr.Shermer.
